title: Electron Microscopy Investigations of Phase Transformations in Mixed Metal Oxides
content: The investigation of phase transformation in mixed metal oxide holds paramount importance from both a fundamental and application perspective, as distinct electronic, optical, and structural properties emerge in different phases [1]. Metal oxides such as WO3 and MoO3 are known for their temperature-dependent phase transformations and exceptional electro-chromic properties [2]. The amalgamation of WO3 and MoO3 into mixed metal oxides presents intriguing possibilities for applications in supercapacitors and gas sensing [3]. However, the exploration of phase transformations in these mixed metal oxides remains incomplete. While existing studies utilizing X-ray diffraction and Raman spectroscopy provide partial insights into phase change [4], a comprehensive understanding of the exact phase transitions and interface structures necessitate microscopic studies.
